title: Victory Square (Piața Victoriei)
description: Victory Square is the heart of Timișoara, featuring the stunning Metropolitan Cathedral and the National Opera House. This square witnessed the 1989 Revolution that started in Timișoara and led to the fall of communism in Romania. The baroque architecture surrounding the square tells stories of the Austro-Hungarian Empire's influence on the city.

images.caption: Victory Square panoramic view with the Metropolitan Cathedral dominating the skyline
Close-up of the Metropolitan Cathedral's stunning Byzantine architecture and golden domes
Victory Square during winter, capturing the essence of historic Timișoara
The National Opera House with its neoclassical facade facing the square
1989 Revolution memorial gathering at Victory Square, where freedom was born

title: Union Square (Piața Unirii)
description: Union Square represents the baroque heart of Timișoara, surrounded by colorful 18th-century buildings. The square was a major commercial center during the Austro-Hungarian period. At its center stands the Holy Trinity Monument, commemorating the plague epidemics of the 18th century. Today, it remains one of the most photographed locations in the city.

images.caption: Union Square's iconic baroque building facades in vibrant yellow and cream
The Holy Trinity Monument at the center of Union Square
Street-level view capturing the ornate details of Austro-Hungarian architecture
Union Square at sunset, with cafes lining the historic buildings

title: Huniade Castle
description: Built between 1443-1447 by John Hunyadi, this castle is one of the oldest monuments in Timișoara. The castle served as royal residence and later as military barracks. Its architectural style shows a unique blend of Gothic and Renaissance elements. Today it houses the Banat Museum, showcasing the region's rich history from prehistoric times to the modern era.

images.caption: Huniade Castle's fortress walls and towers, a testament to medieval military architecture
The castle's inner courtyard showing Gothic arches and Renaissance additions
Detailed view of the castle's stone masonry and defensive structures
Huniade Castle as it appears today, housing the Banat Museum
Historical reconstruction showing the castle during John Hunyadi's reign

title: Liberty Square (Piața Libertății)
description: Liberty Square was the site of crucial events during the 1989 Revolution. The square is dominated by the Serbian Orthodox Cathedral and the Old City Hall. The architecture reflects the multicultural heritage of Timișoara, with Serbian, Hungarian, and Romanian influences. The square remains a symbol of freedom and democracy for the city.

images.caption: Liberty Square with the Serbian Orthodox Cathedral's distinctive green domes
The Old City Hall building showcasing Austro-Hungarian administrative architecture
December 1989 - Crowds gathering in Liberty Square during the Revolution
Modern Liberty Square hosting cultural events and celebrations

title: Timișoara Orthodox Cathedral
description: The Romanian Orthodox Metropolitan Cathedral is one of the most impressive religious buildings in Romania. Built between 1936-1946 in Moldavian architectural style, the cathedral features 11 towers symbolizing Christ and his apostles. The interior is adorned with stunning Byzantine-inspired frescoes. The cathedral serves as the spiritual center of the Orthodox community in western Romania.

images.caption: The Metropolitan Cathedral with all 11 towers representing Christ and the apostles
Close-up of the cathedral's golden crosses and Byzantine architectural elements
Interior view showing magnificent Byzantine frescoes and iconography
The cathedral during construction in the 1940s
Night view of the illuminated cathedral towers

title: Revolution Memorial (1989)
description: This memorial honors the victims of the 1989 Revolution that started in Timișoara on December 16, 1989. The city became known as 'the city that set Romania free' as protests against the communist regime began here. Over 100 people lost their lives fighting for freedom. The memorial features eternal flames and plaques listing the names of those who sacrificed their lives for democracy.

images.caption: The Revolution Memorial with eternal flame honoring fallen heroes
December 16, 1989 - The day the revolution began in Timișoara
Crowds protesting in front of the Communist Party headquarters
Memorial plaques listing the names of revolution martyrs
Annual commemoration ceremony at the memorial

title: Bega Canal
description: The Bega Canal, completed in the 18th century, was a major engineering achievement that transformed Timișoara into a navigable commercial hub. The canal connected the city to the Danube River, facilitating trade and economic development. Today, the canal banks are lined with beautiful promenades, cafes, and cultural venues, making it a favorite spot for locals and tourists alike.

images.caption: Bega Canal waterfront with historic warehouses and buildings
Historical photo of canal boats transporting goods in the 19th century
Modern promenade along the canal with cafes and cultural venues
Reflections of baroque buildings in the calm canal waters
Winter scene along the Bega Canal during the Austro-Hungarian era

title: Roses Park (Parcul Rozelor)
description: Roses Park is one of the oldest and most beautiful parks in Timișoara, established in 1891. The park features over 1,000 varieties of roses, making it a stunning display of colors and fragrances throughout the blooming season. The park also contains the Natural Science Museum and hosts cultural events. It represents the city's dedication to green spaces and quality of life.

images.caption: Roses Park in full bloom with over 1,000 rose varieties on display
Victorian-era pathways through the rose gardens
The Natural Science Museum building within the park
Cultural festival taking place in the park's central plaza
Historic fountain surrounded by rose beds
